title: Online Mathematics Learning Effectiveness Improvement Strategies Using the Advance Organizer Model

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mathematical Concepts and Experience with Online Learning Tools
context.additional_context: Advanced mathematics application course for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields, emphasizing real-time interaction and project-based assessment in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Complex mathematical concepts can be explained with over 80% accuracy using the advance organizer model
Collaborative learning activities with peers utilizing Zoom tools (polls, screen sharing, etc.) can be completed with over 90% success

Learners can select one job-related problem (e.g., inventory optimization, budget allocation) in a week-long PBL assessment, apply at least two mathematical theories (linear programming, statistical modeling, etc.) to design a solution, and achieve a B grade or higher in four of five rubric items (problem definition, theory application, feasibility, creativity, presentation effectiveness).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
